title: Discrete vs Continuous Number Line
description: An interactive visualization that helps students distinguish between discrete and continuous variables by comparing how values can be plotted on two different number lines. The discrete line snaps to integers while the continuous line accepts any value.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Statistics
Data Types
Variables
Number Lines
Discrete Variables
Continuous Variables

controls.name: Reset
controls.description: Clears all placed markers from both number lines

controls.name: Show Examples
controls.description: Toggles display of pre-placed example values on each number line

interactions.description: Places a marker that snaps to the nearest integer value (0-10)
Places a marker at the exact click position, displaying value to 2 decimal places (60-72)
